title: 👋 Welcome
text:
Toggle Dark Mode
By December 2025, I’ll have completed my MBA with electives in Machine Learning Models and Techniques, Cloud Computing Technologies, and AI in Business, all tools I’m eager to bring into real-world projects.

title: 👋 Welcome
text:
💼 What I Do
At Mathnasium, I run daily operations, mentor a team of instructors, and make sure every student’s learning plan feels tailor-made. I bring a mix of teaching expertise, analytical thinking, and leadership skills to the table, plus a healthy dose of curiosity that keeps me learning new tech every chance I get.

title: 👋 Welcome
text:
🚀 Where I’m Headed
I’m passionate about programming and see myself either teaching it, building educational technology solutions, or contributing to IT projects that make learning smarter and more accessible.
If it blends code, creativity, and impact, I’m in.

title: 👋 Welcome
text:
🌟 My Mission
Learning should never feel like a chore. My mission is to combine data-driven insights with creative problem-solving to design learning experiences that actually stick, and maybe even make people smile along the way.

title: 👋 Welcome
text:
🎨 Beyond the MBA
When I’m not managing a learning center or tinkering with code, you’ll probably find me sketching.
You can see some of my work here: Instagram Art Page
I also enjoy mentoring students, volunteering in education projects, and finding ways to use tech for social good.

title: 👋 Welcome
text:
📬 Let’s Connect
Whether you want to talk data, design, or doodles, I’m just a click away. Head over to my Contact page and say hi.

title: Resume
text:
Toggle Dark Mode

💼 Experience
Assistant Centre Director
Mathnasium of West Vancouver | May 2024 – Present
- Manage day-to-day centre operations and lead the instructional team
- Provide high-quality customer support and sales consultation to families
- Support the Centre Director in planning, scheduling, and performance tracking
- Drive collaboration and team culture to ensure student success
Programming & Math Instructor
WhiteHat Jr. | Aug 2020 – Feb 2024
- Delivered 1:1 and small group programming lessons to students globally (Grades 4–10)
- Taught real-world projects involving games, websites, apps, data science, VR/AR, and cybersecurity
- Conducted interactive and story-based math sessions for Grades 7–8
- Taught students from diverse regions including the US, UK, Canada, Australia, and more
